rule: The output must only include the name of the category without any additional text, explanation, or context.
validityText:
The input "Google reveals out-of-this-world holiday doodles" is analyzed to determine its compliance with the input specification. The input is a string, satisfying the requirement for the input to be a string. It resembles a news headline and touches on a technology company's creative endeavor, potentially fitting within the 'Sci/Tech' category, as the Google doodles often have a technological theme. The term "out-of-this-world" could imply an exceptional or sci-tech related aspect, possibly linking to innovation.

No restriction on the length of the input string is violated here, and it is in English, which complies with the language specification requirement. 

Based on this analysis, the input meets the conditions outlined in the input specification as it can be reasonably classified under the 'Sci/Tech' category, making it a valid input.

OK
coverageEvalText:
No violation. The output "Sci/Tech" is one of the categories specified in the chatbot description (World, Sports, Business, Sci/Tech). 
OK
